text: Hi. Since I am relatively new to Julia was wondering if it is possible to fit HMM model to my multivariate data where the first two columns are following Normal distribution and the last two columns as binomial (success and failures) ?  Thanks!

elements.text: Hi. Since I am relatively new to Julia was wondering if it is possible to fit HMM model to my multivariate data where the first two columns are following Normal distribution and the last two columns as binomial (success and failures) ?  Thanks!

text: Not sure of the ecosystem for HMM from a maximum likelihood perspective. But from a Bayesian perspective there is <https://turing.ml/stable/>, who are also active here in  in <#CCYDC34A0|turing>.

attachments.title: Turing.jl - Turing.jl
attachments.text: Turing: A robust, efficient and modular library for general-purpose probabilistic programming.

text: First of all thanks. Yes. I had a look into Turing.jl but was not clear. maybe I also post in that channel.
